messages.title: Securing a better future for Portsmouth and Southsea
messages.content: This year’s General Election is the most important in a generation - whether or not you and your family can look forward to a better, more secure future is at stake. As things stand the outcome is too close to call - only your vote could be the difference. Because the Portsmouth South constituency is one of just 23 seats that the Conservatives need to win to form a majority government, keep the economic recovery on track, and stop the Coalition.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Reduce the deficit, cut income taxes, create more jobs, and foster new businesses.
Advocate for high standards in schools like Charter Academy, work to keep p the school, and support teachers needing more support and training.
Ensure 24/7 access to GPs so that no one has to wait until Monday if they are sick, make sure patients get appointments, and establish walk-in clinics more frequently.
Continue to reduce crime rates and address issues such as shops selling alcohol to underage customers.
Support small businesses like Kevin's Venue of Nettitude to grow, succeed, and keep local high streets thriving.
Keep the city green and pleasant by working for better parks and green spaces and to keep our streets cleaner.

mentions.candidate: Flick Drummond, Parliamentary Candidate for Portsmouth South
mentions.tacticalSituation: Portsmouth South is one of just 23 seats that the Conservatives need to win to form a majority government.

issues.brexitEurope: Keep the commitment to a referendum on Britain's EU membership and then you will decide on Britain’s future in Europe.
issues.economy: Conservatives plan to turn the economy around and keep the economic recovery on track.
issues.environment: Work to keep Portsmouth pleasant and tidy, with mentions of supporting Pompey Litter Pickers.

leaflet.personalStatement: Flick Drummond talks about living in the city for the last 8 years and promises to make Portsmouth an even better place with hard work, vision, and a record of investment in jobs and infrastructure.

images.caption: Flick holds regular street stalls to meet and listen to you.
Flick set up Pompey Litter Pickers in response to your complaints about rubbish on our streets.
Talking to Government Ministers about issues in Portsmouth Health Service.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet outlines a strong opposition to what they term 'coalition of chaos', highlighting the Conservatives as a better option for the future. The leaflet includes a personal message from Flick Drummond, focuses on her 6-point plan for the city, and outlines the importance of the constituency in the upcoming General Election.
